fenceTypes.name: Wood Fences

features: Premium Western Red Cedar or Pressure-Treated Pine
Multiple styles: Privacy, Semi-Privacy, Picket, Board-on-Board
Paintable and stainable to match your home

benefits.title: Customizable
benefits.description: Wood can be cut, shaped, stained, or painted to achieve any look

benefits.title: Cost-Effective

benefits.title: Natural Aesthetic
benefits.description: Warm, organic appearance that blends with landscaping

benefits.title: Easy Repairs
benefits.description: Individual boards can be replaced without affecting the whole fence

styles.name: Privacy
styles.description: Solid boards with no gaps for maximum privacy

styles.name: Board-on-Board

styles.name: Shadow Box

styles.name: Picket
styles.description: Classic American style with spaced vertical boards

maintenanceTips: Apply stain or sealant every 2-3 years
Inspect for rot or insect damage annually
Keep soil and mulch away from the base
Trim vegetation growing on or near the fence

faqs.question: How long does a wood fence last?
faqs.answer: With proper maintenance, a quality wood fence can last 15-25 years. Cedar naturally resists rot and insects, while pressure-treated pine offers excellent durability at a lower cost.

faqs.question: Should I stain or paint my wood fence?
faqs.answer: Both options work well. Stain penetrates the wood and highlights natural grain, while paint provides more color options. Either will protect your fence from weather damage.

faqs.question: What's the difference between cedar and pressure-treated?
faqs.answer: Cedar is naturally rot and insect resistant with a beautiful appearance. Pressure-treated pine is more affordable and equally durable but has a greenish tint that weathers to gray.

seo.title: Wood Fence Installation Toledo OH | Cedar & Privacy Fences
seo.description: Professional wood fence installation in Toledo OH. Cedar privacy fences, picket fences, and custom designs. Free estimates from Ghareeb Fencing Solutions.

fenceTypes.name: Vinyl Fences
fenceTypes.description: Vinyl fencing provides the classic look of wood without the maintenance. Our premium vinyl fences won't rot, warp, or fade, giving you a beautiful fence that looks great year after year with minimal upkeep.
features: Premium virgin vinyl - no recycled materials
UV inhibitors prevent fading and yellowing
Won't rot, warp, splinter, or crack

benefits.title: Zero Maintenance
benefits.description: Simply rinse with a garden hose to clean

benefits.title: Lifetime Durability
benefits.description: Won't rot, rust, or deteriorate like wood or metal

benefits.title: Color Options
benefits.description: Available in white, tan, gray, and wood-grain textures

benefits.title: Child & Pet Safe
benefits.description: No splinters, sharp edges, or toxic treatments

styles.name: Semi-Privacy
styles.description: Spaced boards allow light and airflow

maintenanceTips: Rinse with garden hose as needed
Use mild soap for stubborn dirt
Inspect after severe storms for damage
Avoid harsh chemicals or pressure washers

faqs.question: Is vinyl fencing strong enough?
faqs.answer: Yes! Quality vinyl fencing is 5x stronger than wood. It's engineered to withstand high winds, impacts, and extreme temperatures without breaking.

faqs.question: Does vinyl fade over time?
faqs.answer: Our premium vinyl includes UV inhibitors that prevent fading and yellowing. Your fence will look great for decades.

faqs.question: Can vinyl fencing handle Ohio winters?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Vinyl is specifically designed to handle freeze-thaw cycles, snow, and ice without cracking or warping.

fenceTypes.description: Chain link fencing is the most economical fencing option while still providing excellent security and durability. Perfect for residential yards, commercial properties, and sports facilities.
features: Vinyl-coated options in black, green, brown
Privacy slats available for added screening

benefits.title: Budget-Friendly
benefits.description: Lowest cost per linear foot of any fence type

benefits.title: Highly Durable
benefits.description: Galvanized steel lasts 20+ years with minimal maintenance

benefits.title: See-Through Design
benefits.description: Maintains visibility while providing boundary definition

benefits.title: Quick Installation
benefits.description: Fastest fence type to install

styles.name: Vinyl Coated

styles.name: Privacy Slats

maintenanceTips: Check for rust spots annually
Touch up with rust-resistant paint as needed
Ensure tension wires remain tight
Clear debris from bottom of fence

faqs.question: Can I add privacy to chain link?
faqs.answer: Yes! Privacy slats, mesh screens, or hedge planting can all add privacy to an existing chain link fence without replacing it.

faqs.question: What's the difference between galvanized and vinyl-coated?
faqs.answer: Galvanized is the classic silver look and most affordable. Vinyl-coated comes in colors (black, green, brown) and offers extra corrosion protection.

faqs.question: How high can chain link go?
faqs.answer: Residential typically goes up to 6ft. We can install up to 12ft for commercial and industrial applications with proper permitting.

features: Powder-coated finish resists rust and corrosion

benefits.title: Rust-Free

maintenanceTips: Rinse with water to remove dirt and debris
Inspect powder coating for chips annually
Touch up chips with matching paint
Lubricate gate hinges and latches

faqs.question: Is aluminum strong enough for security?
faqs.answer: Yes. Modern aluminum fencing is engineered with reinforced rails and posts. While not as heavy as steel, it's more than adequate for residential security needs.

faqs.question: What colors are available?
faqs.answer: Standard colors include black, bronze, and white. Custom powder coating in other colors is available for an additional cost.

faqs.question: Can aluminum fencing go around a pool?
faqs.answer: Yes! We install pool-code compliant aluminum fencing with self-closing, self-latching gates that meet all Ohio pool safety requirements.

fenceTypes.name: Composite Fences
fenceTypes.description: Composite fencing combines recycled wood fibers with plastic polymers to create a fence that looks like wood but performs like vinyl. Eco-friendly, durable, and beautiful.
features: Made from recycled wood and plastic
Natural wood grain texture and appearance
Won't rot, warp, splinter, or crack

benefits.title: Authentic Wood Look
benefits.description: Realistic grain patterns mimic natural wood

benefits.title: Environmentally Friendly
benefits.description: Made from recycled materials

benefits.title: Extreme Durability
benefits.description: Resists rot, insects, and weather damage

benefits.title: Color Retention
benefits.description: UV protection prevents fading

maintenanceTips: Clean with soap and water annually
Remove mold or mildew with appropriate cleaner
Inspect hardware for corrosion
No painting, staining, or sealing needed

faqs.question: Is composite more expensive than wood?
faqs.answer: Yes, the upfront cost is higher. However, with zero maintenance costs over its lifetime, composite often costs less than wood in the long run.

faqs.question: Does composite fade in the sun?
faqs.answer: Quality composite fencing includes UV inhibitors that minimize fading. Some initial lightening is normal but stabilizes within the first year.

faqs.question: Can composite be painted?
faqs.answer: While possible, it's not recommended. The factory color is designed to last the life of the fence and painting may void the warranty.

benefits.title: Fire Resistant

Keep vegetation trimmed away from fence

faqs.question: Will steel rust?
faqs.answer: Modern steel fencing is galvanized and powder-coated to resist rust. With proper maintenance and touch-ups, rust is rarely an issue.

faqs.question: Is steel fencing good for security?
faqs.answer: Yes, steel is the strongest fencing option available. We offer anti-climb designs and security spear tops for maximum protection.

faqs.question: How does steel compare to aluminum?
faqs.answer: Steel is heavier and stronger, making it better for high-security needs. Aluminum is lighter, never rusts, and is better for decorative residential use.

faqs.question: What's the best fence for horses?
faqs.answer: We recommend no-climb woven wire or board fencing for horses. These designs prevent horses from getting legs caught and reduce injury risk.

faqs.question: How much does farm fencing cost?
faqs.answer: Farm fencing is our most affordable option, starting around $8 per linear foot for basic wire fencing. Board and split rail cost more but offer better aesthetics.

faqs.question: Do you install electric fencing?
faqs.answer: Yes, we install electric fence systems for livestock containment. We can also add electric strands to existing fence for added security.

faqs.question: Can you automate an existing gate?
faqs.answer: In many cases, yes. We can retrofit automatic operators to existing gates. We'll assess your gate to determine if it's a good candidate for automation.

faqs.question: What access options are available?
faqs.answer: We offer keypads, remote controls, smartphone apps, intercom systems, and card readers. We can help you choose the right system for your needs.

faqs.question: How wide should a driveway gate be?
faqs.answer: Most residential driveways need gates 10-16 feet wide. We'll measure your driveway and recommend the appropriate size for your vehicles.
